description: From Middle English forwepen, equivalent to for- +‎ weep.

verbs.description: forweep (third-person singular simple present forweeps, present participle forweeping, simple past and past participle forwept)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, chiefly obsolete) To exhaust (oneself) with weeping; weep excessively; (of a vine) to bleed excessively.
examples: Till at the last an aged knight, / Which seem'd a man in greate thought, / Like as he set all thing at nought, / With visage and eyes all forwept, / And pale, as a man long unslept,  […]
